basis: The user explicitly commits to following the ultra-simple plan (shade, water, 60-second calm breath) and check-ins, with an intention to try a grape only if safe, and to seek clinician help if symptoms persist. This reflects a high likelihood of taking aligned actions.
cognitive_dissonance: Ambivalence between adhering to a slow, safe plan and the urge to snack or ease distress; competing drives between self-protective caution and the desire to eat, all within a context of irregular eating and external suggestions.
negative_thought_patterns: Tendency toward safety-first planning (hyper-caution), possible all-or-nothing thinking about eating, worry about distress if eating occurs, anticipatory anxiety about symptoms.
emotional_triggers: Anxiety about distress, heat-related discomfort, irregular eating patterns, influence of external prompts, fear of making things worse.
coaching_notes: Continue delivering ultra-simple, small-step actions; validate feelings and progress; reinforce the option to pause or skip any step without judgment; consider adding brief grounding or distraction techniques if anxiety rises; remind about clinician support if symptoms persist or worsen.
